description.narrative: By the end of 2018, access, quality and equity of fundamental school is improved through classroom construction and equipment, dissemination of teaching and learning materials, integration of conflict sensitive concepts and CFS in the curriculum, with emphasis on vulnerable children.

sector.narrative: Breastfeeding protection, promotion and support (including work on Code)
Education analyses including OOSCI, Education Sector Analyses, etc.
Other activities for equitable access to quality education e.g. school feeding, school grants
Provision of (formal and non-formal) multiple-levels or alternative pathways of education (including in temporary learning spaces)
Provision of multiple-levels (or alternative pathways of education) teacher training
Provision of parental education for school readiness (including in temporary learning spaces)
Provision of skills development for adolescents (10-19 year-olds) (including in temporary learning spaces)
Provision or procurement of primary education learning materials
System strengthening - community participation and social accountability, e.g. school management committees
System strengthening - curricula and learning materials design (excluding early-learning / pre-primary)
System strengthening - inclusive education for children with disabilities

description.narrative: Development Partner affairs policy planning and administration
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

title.narrative: Burundi United Nations Development Assistance Framework
Burundi Country Programme Document 2010-2014 Results Matrix
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By the end of 2018, access, quality and equity of fundamental school is improved through classroom construction and equipment, dissemination of teaching and learning materials, integration of conflict sensitive concepts and CFS in the curriculum, with emphasis on vulnerable children.

description.narrative: A total of 1,500,000 children benefited from UNICEF's continued support for provision of learning and teaching materials (including 1,200,000 school kits), increased access to quality education through construction of 136 classrooms and building capacity nationwide of basic education school directors, inspectors and Cycle 4 teachers for the new curriculum. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2018

title.narrative: Service Delivery - School kits funded by UNICEF
Service Delivery - Classrooms provided with classroom education materials funded by UNICEF, see guidance
% of fundamental schools with functional school management committees
Service Delivery - Primary education textbooks purchased with funding managed by UNICEF and distributed
# of fundamental school teachers who received training with funding provided by UNICEF
